description: The Gameboy Color version of Pokemon Pinball.

pokepinball_v0.0.1.description:
A not completely finished but mostly playable build for Pokemon Pinball for Archipelago. Releasing this so that it at least can be played by people who may want to play it but keep in mind there are several graphical bugs and can be generally wonky at times so play are your own risk. 

## Setup
### Installation
Same as most other unsupported Gameboy apworld,

simply move pokemon_pinball.apworld into the custom_worlds directory in your Archipelago install server
(default path: C:\ProgramData\Archipelago\custom_worlds) 
or simply double click the apworld and it should install itself (Archipelago version 0.5.0 and later)

### Running
In the Archipelago launcher push the 'Generate Template Options' button to generate a yaml for your options
Like every other apworld, fill out your yaml options and have the host generate the multiworld, the produced zip file should contain a .pokepinball patch file. Receive this .pokepinball patch from the multiworld host.
Push the 'Open Patch' button in the launcher and it should ask for a 'Pokemon Pinball (US)' legal ROM dump (MD5 Hash: `fbe20570c2e52c937a9395024069ba3c`), then select the generated .pokepinball patch file to produce a .gbc ROM which should auto launch in a bizhawk instance. You should be set otherwise from here just follow the same instructions as any other supported GBC apworld.


## What's Randomized

### Items
- Travel Destinations

### Locations
- Pokedex Entries
- Certain board events
- Scores

### Goals
Each can be toggled independently
- Reaching a certain pokedex count
- Reaching a certain score
- Catching specific Pokemon

If you find any issues or bugs please post them in the Pokemon Pinball Apworld thread, all updates will be posted here on the github.
pokepinball_v0.0.1.title: Pokemon Pinball Apworld v0.0.1

pokepinball_v0.0.2.description:
A not completely finished but mostly playable build for Pokemon Pinball for Archipelago. 

## Updates
- Goal is now properly completable
- Catchem Mode item catches are now properly tracked
- Ball upgrade should work
- Marquee text has been adjusted so that the game doesn't lock up as much

## Setup
### Installation
Same as most other unsupported Gameboy apworld,

simply move pokemon_pinball.apworld into the custom_worlds directory in your Archipelago install server
(default path: C:\ProgramData\Archipelago\custom_worlds) 
or simply double click the apworld and it should install itself (Archipelago version 0.5.0 and later)

### Running
In the Archipelago launcher push the 'Generate Template Options' button to generate a yaml for your options
Like every other apworld, fill out your yaml options and have the host generate the multiworld, the produced zip file should contain a .pokepinball patch file. Receive this .pokepinball patch from the multiworld host.
Push the 'Open Patch' button in the launcher and it should ask for a 'Pokemon Pinball (US)' legal ROM dump (MD5 Hash: `fbe20570c2e52c937a9395024069ba3c`), then select the generated .pokepinball patch file to produce a .gbc ROM which should auto launch in a bizhawk instance. You should be set otherwise from here just follow the same instructions as any other supported GBC apworld.


## What's Randomized

### Items
- Travel Destinations

### Locations
- Pokedex Entries
- Certain board events
- Scores

### Goals
Each can be toggled independently
- Reaching a certain pokedex count
- Reaching a certain score
- Catching specific Pokemon

If you find any issues or bugs please post them in the Pokemon Pinball Apworld thread, all updates will be posted here on the github.
pokepinball_v0.0.2.title: Pokemon Pinball Apworld v0.0.2

pokepinball_v0.0.3.description:
## Updates
- Added the ability to exit bonus stages by holding Select + B (also works in catchem mode)
- Changes for Archipelago v0.6.4 compatibility
pokepinball_v0.0.3.title: Pokemon Pinball Apworld v0.0.3

pokepinball_v0.0.4.description:
## Updates
- Added Option Groups
- Fixed an issue where the upper limit for the points goal could be set way too high
pokepinball_v0.0.4.title: Pokemon Pinball Apworld v0.0.4
